*NOTE: 1296 x 544 is better then 1280 x 528. 1296/544=2.382
Here is the image from bluray.com;  <a href=" http://i.imgbox.com/aadbHvVP.jpg" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://i.imgbox.com/aadbHvVP.jpg</a> where 138px must be cropped from top and bottom resulting to 1920 / 806 = 2,382
So all the other 720p encodes from the net have wrong AR (1280 / 528 = 2,424).

Not that it matters so much but before bitching about my "weird" AR do the right maths. If 99% of people do it differently doesn't always mean that the 1% do it wrong.

One more thing. The very early "BDRips & BRRips" were encoded (re-coded LOL) from R5, a telecine (fake BD) russian pre-release (1H 40mn 48s).
Read about R5;  <a href=" http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R5_%28bootleg%29" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R5_%28bootleg%29</a>

I also added "Drive (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack) CBR 320kbps" (19 tracks, 161 MB) since I found them very special ;-)
